attributes.action: Introduce medical intervention sooner for those suffering with Anorexia Nervosa
attributes.background: Medical intervention should begin sooner to prevent a patients rapid deterioration of health. Counselling as a first form of treatment is not at all useful on its own if the patient is suffering malnourishment. Their brain lacks ability to concentrate and withhold useful advice and information.
attributes.additional_details: Medical and counselling services should work hand in hand to ensure fast diagnosis and early intervention. Medical help to prevent extreme rapid deterioration of an individual health is vital. Much to the individuals refusal and disapproval this should be pressed or encouraged to help the recovery process begin as soon as possible. Putting off recovery will only prolong the suffering and tormenting thoughts, allowing them to become the only way in life like a 'voice' that must be abided by.

attributes.action: Vote on whether the Houses of Parliament should be refurbished or rebuilt.
attributes.background: In a time of mass austerity, £4b to refurbish The Houses of Parliament over 6 years NOT including fees for renting elsewhere. £7.1b over 32 years if they stay inside. We the people believe that the palace should be kept for historical value and a new building be built for a fraction of the price.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is there. This needs to be done and the savings go back into the publics purse, helping stop austerity on the sick and disabled. Fund more homeless shelters, stock the food banks!!! Act NOW not tomorrow!

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/708740/houses-of-parliament-restoration-48bn-to-do-list-westminster

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-refurbishment-7bn-westminster-revamp-faces-three-year-delay-a6872141.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37303682

attributes.action: Bring the child victims of the Syrian conflict to the UK and Europe.
attributes.background: Every day for the past five years a child has lost its life due to the conflict. The world has stood by for way to long and watched children pay the price for adult wars! it is my belief we have a OBLIGATION to rescue and protect as many of these children as we can.
attributes.additional_details: It is only since the outrage over Aylan Kurdi and now Omran Daqneesh the world has woken up and realized what the Syrian people have been dealing with as daily life for five whole years. It is in my belief we should ALL be doing what we can to evacuate these children and home them in safe countries. They do not deserve to pay the price for adult wars and this MUST be stopped! There must be relief provided and as many children evacuated as possible. Thank you all for your support.

attributes.action: Video all pip and esa assessments
attributes.background: There seems to be so many stories that atos, capita and other assessment companies are causing benefits to be stopped because of their lies... if they are video recorded then each party is completely backed up

attributes.action: Give the NHS a percentage of tuition fees from all HE health careers courses.
attributes.background: The NHS would benefit from extra funding. They should be given a percentage of tuition fees from all health careers courses. Students studying these courses should oblige as the NHS is the future for the majority of their career. The extra funds would help with the upkeep and development of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is suffering from a lack of funding and a lack of staff. If they were to recieve a percentage of student tuition fees (only from health related courses) then there would be a boost in funding. It could also be an incentive to encourage more people to study these courses and eventually work for the NHS, as they would feel as though there University costs have contributed to their future career on another level.

attributes.action: Introducing funding to help those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: There are many people in the UK that are experiencing mental health issues. This is a problem as people are still suffering from theses issues and not had the support needed. This has caused people to be in a worse situation than they would of if the had the support in the first place.
attributes.additional_details: This is important to me as i am experiencing this myself. I am wanting to change this  and stop making people waiting for professional help and get the qualified people in. By raising awareness we can make those vulnerable people and their friends and families feel they are not alone and make more peoples lives better. This can be done with more advertisement, more qualified professionals to set up more social action projects and one to one appointments.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: I want the mandatory tv licence in September to be abolished.
attributes.background: Come September 1 2016 you will be required by law to purchase a television licence, regardless of how you watch - this includes YouTube and BBC iPlayer etc.
attributes.additional_details:
From the TV licence website - 

No matter what device you use, you must be covered by a TV Licence if you watch or record live TV. This includes:
TV sets
Laptops and desktop computers
Tablets, mobile phones, satnavs and other portable devices
Digital boxes (PVRs), satellite and cable, e.g. Freeview, Freesat, Sky, Virgin Media, BT Vision, YouView, Apple TV, Chromecast, Roku and Amazon Fire TV
Games consoles
DVD, Blu-ray and VHS recorders

http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: The government should prevent the sale of ARM, the biggest and most successful British technology company to the Japanese company Softbank.  With designs used in over 90% of devices, the idea that only another company can support its growth is invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government truly believes in businesses that can compete in the world then it must realise it takes decades to develop companies such as ARM and coming under foreign ownership when not needed is only ultimately strategically beneficial for the foreign company and bad for national self-esteem.  

The sale of ARM will represent the end of real British involvement in any significant way in the ever-growing, ever important technology sector.

attributes.action: Change the law for drink driving limit to zero and an instant ban
attributes.background:
Far to many innocent people are killed every year by drink drivers. 
It's time a stop is put to it by ways of zero tolerance and instant bans being handed out for any who fail a road side breath test.

attributes.action:
Outlaw Investor-State Dispute Settlements
(Investors Suing the U.K. Government)
attributes.background: Investor-State Dispute Settlement clauses in trade deals provide a means for foreign investors to sue governments for policies which harm their profits. If successful, taxpayer money is used to pay damages to them. A government can thus be more beholden to corporations than the public they serve.
attributes.additional_details:
The TTIP trade agreement contains one such ISDS clause. The Trans Pacific Partnership (TPP) and Trade In Services Agreement (TISA) have one also. 
Secretly negotiated, they ensure foreign corps are able to sue 2/3 of the world's governments and block trade with the emerging economies of China, Brazil, Russia, India and S. Africa. 
Examples:
Vattenfall vs Germany for phasing out nuclear energy ($3.7bn)
Veolia vs Egypt (introducing a minimum wage)
B.A.T. vs Australia (tobacco advertising laws)

attributes.action: Add a capture code to the government petition site to prevent false signatures.
attributes.background: It is now common knowledge that the petition calling for a second referendum has been compromised. A hacker group is using a computerised bot to generate signatures. This petition should now be made null and void and all future petitions should have a captcha code, proving the signature is real
attributes.additional_details: There should also be a way of cross referencing the post code used, with the electoral register, to prevent miscreants from passing their post code for use to all and sundry.

attributes.action: Work with the other 27 states to reform the EU to an acceptable standard for all
attributes.background: It is not mandatory to act in accordance with a referendum. In the interests of peace, humanity and national security the Government should disregard the recent result, NOT trigger Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty but work with the 27 states to reform the EU in a way that is acceptable to all members
attributes.additional_details:
The first incarnation of the European Union was formed in 1957 by 6 countries, previously in conflict, to show allegiance to each other and prevent the further outbreak of war within Europe. 

On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted in a referendum to leave the EU and in the proceeding 5 days witnessed several disturbing acts of unrest and general tension as a result.

attributes.action: If Brexit happens. All previous EU spending should be forced to go to the NHS.
attributes.background: The Leave campaign made promises that the money spent in the EU would go to the NHS. They should be forced to up keep that promise.

attributes.action: Control the right to vote, by a political knowledge test.
attributes.background:
Voters have no political knowledge to vote fairly.
It is a duty of every voter to know the theory behind every voting and base the opinion and vote on true facts and figures. 
To help the nation understand the politics and consequences of choices, 'right to vote' control is urgently needed.

attributes.action: We the people of Britain demand more funds to strengthen the NHS.
attributes.background:
As we know the wonderful NHS is failing the people of Britain due to big"cuts" and we stress that more cuts will end the NHS and certainly lead to a weaker and unhealthy Britain. 
I call on the government to put more effort and funds into the NHS to strengthen its weakness. Who is with me on this.
attributes.additional_details: Online researchers have carried out a questionnaire on the failure of the NHS the outcome is shameful, Also the amount of hospitals closing in Britain is dreadful this is due to "Cuts" and lack of funds, and the taxpayers pay in to receive a good strong Heath system. It's time to strengthen are NHS and fast, we the people of Britain demand more funding NOW! Number of deaths that occurred under the  conservative government is very high.

attributes.action: Bring back capital punishment for peodophiles and child sex offenders
attributes.background: Make the future safer for kids.

attributes.action: Impose a cap on tuition fees at £9000 for EU students until 2020.
attributes.background: Due to the result of the recent EU referendum, many EU students who want to study in Britain in coming years now face prices of up to £20,000 as they will be deemed as international students.  To make it fair for these students, we are proposing capping tuition fees until 2020.

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britain’s war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: Tax all products containing palm oil
attributes.background: The production of palm oil is a dangerous and environmentaly disastrous procedure. It produces vast quantities of CO2 as well as damaging local ecosystems and the worldwide environment. Place a tax on all products in the UK to reduce its sales.

attributes.action: Change divorce law! Make "no fault" divorce possible.
attributes.background: No one wants to encourage a break up. But if couples talk the D-word, it is because the marriage is over. We need a simpler, administrative process that keeps kids safe and won't break the bank. It needs to help people, so they can put their kids first!
attributes.additional_details:
The law says you have to either divorce by waiting 2 years or 5 years OR you have to choose a reason like "adultery" or "unreasonable behaviour" or "desertion". 
"Why should it be easy? Kids need their parents to stay together" I hear you say...The trouble is, lawyers get round the divorce law very easily, but at great expense to their clients. Letters about petitions back and forth, outrage at the particulars, common sense out the window. ££££ for lawyers. Madness! Sign the petition to help.

attributes.action: Change laws on house buying/selling make "accepted offer" legally binding
attributes.background: Currently there is no law or anything legally binding once an offer is accepted, if the buyer pulls out at any time. Which can cause the loss of survey fees and solicitors fees to the buyer. An there is nothing the buyer can do to recoup these costs or any impact on the seller currently.
attributes.additional_details: If this happens a few times this can result in the buyer losing thousands of pounds. A house is one of the biggest expenses and outgoings we incur in our lives. With this uncertainly in can put new buyers off as a house in not guaranteed currently until contracts are completed. An existing home movers off as they just can't take the chance of losing that additional money. Plus the seller and pull out currently with no impact to themselves currently.

attributes.action: Make it law that all ice rinks make you wear crash helmets and elbow protection.
attributes.background:
As a child growing up going ice skating i never wore crash helmets or elbow protection. 
As a adult taking my own children I have not made them either wear protection whilst Ice Skating, but when they go doughnutting they do wear crash helmets Recently i suffered a head injury ice skating.
attributes.additional_details:
I fell smashed my head on the Ice and have been suffering server concussion for 3 weeks and still recovering,So the last 3 weeks my 4 children , grandma and my husband all have to look after me as I have not been able to do anything . 

Please read about concussion and sign the petition keep all our children and parents safe . Thank you for your time

attributes.action: Impose stiffer penalties for hand held mobile phone use in vehicles.
attributes.background:
Use of such phones is not diminishing . Evidence from police force videos shows drivers talking and texting or viewing smartphone content. 
Phone logs time stamp usage
Current penalties are not fit for purpose. 
The consequences of accidents caused by such drivers are totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
A Zero Tolerance deterrent is urgently needed to make the results of a conviction more meaningful to the driver and on a par with the offence of drink-driving.  

- An immediate suspension of the driving licence upon apprehension

- On conviction, automatic 12 month disqualification, 6 points on the    licence and £1000 fine, plus seizure of the mobile device.

- If convicted a second time, the courts should be allowed to impose unlimited disqualification, fine or even imprisonment.

attributes.action: Put cameras on Humber Bridge to catch speeders, tailgaters & poor drivers
attributes.background: The bridge is often closed for hours on end because theres been an accident caused by someones poor driving. The speed limit is 50, but drivers often go upwards of 60. The drivers are inches away from other car bumpers, trying to intimidate the other cars into going faster than the 50 limit
attributes.additional_details: There are cameras at the booths. These have witnessed road rage incidents, & drivers going through the tag lane above 50 (the limit at the booths is 30)

attributes.action: A newborn baby to be screened for Krabbe Disease
attributes.background: I have a best friend that tried years to get pregnant. When she finally become pregnant she was over the moon. She then become pregnant with her second child which was then found out to have Krabbe Disease at 13 months old which there is currently no cure for and they don't screen for when born.
attributes.additional_details: In America they screen newborn babies for Krabbe Disease but not in the uk. This is a very serious condition which there is no cure. It is a gene which one or both parents carry and can pass it on to the child without even knowing. If it's not found early enough then a child can die by the age of two years with late onset Krabbe Diease. This needs to become part of screening with a newborn ASAP. Please help make this happen!!

attributes.action: The U.K. Military should under no circumstances engage in the defence of Turkey
attributes.background: Given the recent provocative attacks of Turkey in the Middle East and provocations against Russia from Turkey the UK should not deploy any of its military forces as part of a NATO defence of turkey should they be counter attacked by countries that Turkey is antagonising.

attributes.action: Return the District Councils to Cornwall
attributes.background:
Since Cornwall Council was formed it has wasted so much money. 

It is time for the government to return Cornwall to District Councils and to abolish Cornwall Council.

attributes.action: Make a&e more equipped with private room& bathroom when dealing with miscarriage
attributes.background: Its the most horrific experience for a women and her partner to go throught and should be dealt with respectful no women should have to sit in a room full of people or have to clean herself up in a dirty bathroom that drunks go in in a&e

attributes.action: Increase the Carer's Allowance to £80 per week, from £62.10 per week
attributes.background: There are an estimated 6.5 million carers in the UK, meaning that 1 in 10 people have caring duties. Unpaid carers save the UK government £119 billion per year, more than is spent on the NHS. To receive the carers allowance, you must care for 35 hours a week, when many care for 100 hours or more.
attributes.additional_details: Working up to 100 hours, the Carer's Allowance equates to 62p per hour, in contrast to the minimum wage of £7.20 per hour. The burden of caring is great, with 625,000 carers suffering from mental or physical illnesses - around the population of Glasgow. The problem will only get worse with 6,000 people becoming carers every day - these people need help now.

attributes.action: Do not open a UK trade hub in any state that discriminates against LGBT+ people
attributes.background: The Department for International Trade, led by Dr Liam Fox who has the worst LGBT+ voting record of any cabinet member, intends to open a UK trade hub in Raleigh, North Carolina. This is despite the fact that the state's HB2 permits businesses to directly discriminate against the LGBT+ community.
attributes.additional_details:
HMG should join Paypal, HP, Deutsche Bank and others in refusing to support North Carolina until HB2 is repealed.

The DfIT has a duty not to send its LGBT+ staff, contractors and their families to states which treat them as second class citizens in a climate of fear and prejudice.

HMG has a duty to the global LGBT+ community to send a clear signal, even to our allies, that this discrimination is totally unacceptable. HMG must stand up for those struggling against injustice everywhere.

attributes.action: Call for the DVLA to standardise gender identification on UK licences
attributes.background: Join us to campaign for gender equality. While licences for men start with their first name, all women have their first name prefixed with a marital status title such as 'Miss' / 'Mrs'. These options are selected at application stage, but whereby men selecting 'Mr' do not have this appear, women do.
attributes.additional_details: As a British National, only two forms of photo ID are recongnised; your passport and driver's licence. You driving licence is designed to be credit card sized, and in robust, thick plastic to be carried on your person at all times (unlike a paper passport). I love our country believe that in 2016 persons should be allowed to have their main, day-to-day ID display a fair indicator of the gender they identify with, rather than singling out women with a relationship status.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wages for 17-20 year olds.
attributes.background: National minimum wage for 17-20 year old's should be increased, wages they receive are not just. Being a 20 year old earning £5.50 p/h is inadequate, knowing how much effort and sacrifice you put into working alongside studying. Yet we are liable for paying adult fares on public transport.

attributes.action: New Prime Minister Theresa May suspend HS2 until Brexit negotiations complete
attributes.background:
Economic case for HS2 can't be justified until all Brexit negotiations complete & or 2nd referendum.
Under Brexit if carried out, London may no longer retain hub status. If Scotland negotiates to remain in EU, strong economic case for HS2 Phase1 connecting northern England with Edinburgh & Glasgow
attributes.additional_details:
Assumptions of HS2 economic projections are based on London being at focal point of connection between UK & other European countries. Logic may now not hold true.
Until full scale of Brexit negotiations are known economic case for HS2 is tenuous.
If after Brexit negotiations on UK leaving EU, Scotland negotiates to remain part of EU, perfectly conceivable Edinburgh & Glasgow could become significant economic hubs in their own right. Trade is more likely to flow via Scotland in such a scenario.

attributes.action: Change the gambling age to 21+ now!
attributes.background: With more and more gambling sites appearing, new bookies opening daily, and the sponsorships of Gambling companies appearing all over, and around our sport teams stadiums and merchandise. Our younger generation is constantly force fed and reminded of these companies.
attributes.additional_details: With a National Lottery ticket you must be 16+, Any bookies and/or Casino 18+, I feel if we postpone the ability to gamble, this will have massive benefits to the younger generation as they'll have a much better understanding of money and it's worth at the age of 21, as opposed to 16/18. Let's take control of early addiction, and encourage our own self-success.

attributes.action: Local Council Register all fitness professionals that can practice legitimately
attributes.background: Currently there is no regulation of non qualified fitness professionals from practising without qualifications and insurance. To maintain standards a register of all trading fitness/massage persons working/earning should be controlled by local councils. REPS and CIMSPA can only regulate upon members
attributes.additional_details: Poor quality and lack of knowledge isn't the way forward to providing good exercise prescription. This just simply isn't safe if you are charging the client or giving it for free. If you have no qualifications/experience you can mislead people into thinking you can training healthy people or people with diagnosed medical conditions or injuries or even have no insurance. We must raise the standard of what clients have as a fitness professional and impose some kind of penalty.

attributes.action: Compulsory educational visits to The battle of the Somme and Churchill's bunkers
attributes.background: I feel that children have very little knowledge about the sacrifices soldiers made for our country and why we should always take time to remember them as a mark of respect. It should become part of the curriculum for history and geography.

attributes.background:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too.

attributes.action: Article 50 to not be invoked until mandated by a special general election
attributes.background: Article 50 can only be invoked after passing through Parliament. This proposal allows the electorate to accept or reject the outcome of 'informal' negotiations with the EU through Parliamentary Democracy. All candidates voting intentions to be shown on the ballot paper - EXIT, REMAIN or UNDECLARED
attributes.additional_details: Following the close referendum result the consequences of the outcome have been more clearly understood by the electorate, deep divisions are evident in many areas. This proposal is designed to rebuild unity by making Parliament only accept the proposed 'informal' negotiated terms if so mandated by the electorate. As the voting intentions of each candidate are shown on the ballot paper, the result will either finally confirm the 'exit' referendum result or supersede it.

attributes.action: Invoke The Treaty of Windsor to protect Portuguese in the UK and vice versa
attributes.background: In the spirit of mutual assistance contained within the “Anglo Portuguese Alliance” and with recent post Brexit extremist goading non UK citizens to leave I propose UK give special protection and rights to Portuguese within the UK  and the same protection be afforded to UK citizens in Portugal.
attributes.additional_details:
The Treaty of Windsor has been invoked by the UK on a numbers of occasions to protect the UK including two world wars & the Falklands campaign 
Treaty text of the extant alliance guaranteeing assistance refers: "the ally shall be bound to give aid and succour to the other, so far as he is able (without any deceit, fraud, or pretence) to the extent required by the danger to his ally’s realms, lands, domains, and subjects; and he shall be firmly bound by these present alliances to do this”

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum for British expatriates.
attributes.background:
My family and I (all British Nationals) have lived and worked in France  for the last 25 years.  
The latest EU referendum will have severe repercussions on our future, and we should have the right to participate in the process.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently we can neither vote in UK General Elections nor French Parliamentary or Presidential Elections.  As EU citizens, we can vote in European elections and in French local elections. 
The decision on Britain's continued membership of the EU is of critical importance to us and will have far-reaching consequences for the future of all British nationals living and working in Europe and further afield.

attributes.action: Call for an early election with support for proportional representation.
attributes.background: At a time where the country is in need of leadership, our representation has failed a public of diverse views. Reform is urgently needed to support a liberal democracy, with proportional representation; where ministers are elected based on their qualifications to represent a sector; all views count.
attributes.additional_details:
The lead up to the EU Referendum in the UK has exposed our leaders as being at odds with the public they are meant to serve. A vote of no confidence is required, not just in the party leaders and our Prime Minister, but also in the way the public are represented, and the way in which decisions are made on public services.

We, the undersigned, call for an early election - within the year; with reform for proportional representation and the right to elect ministers based on their qualifications.

attributes.action: All school meals in the UK to be planned and supervised by a nutritionist
attributes.background: Better nutrition for our kids needs to be a priority. Nutrition is the very foundation for a healthy life. Hungry kids tend not to pay attention during class, lack focus and affects their moods.
attributes.additional_details: Example, Finland one of the best education systems in the world, is nutrition part of their success? http://www.oph.fi/download/47657_school_meals_in_finland.pdf

attributes.action: Can you please just raise the speed limit to 80 as 70 is ancient.
attributes.background: I want this petition to go forward as I can not see the point of a 70mph speed limit when on the motorway it feels dangerous as cars fly past well over that and I do not want to break the law to maintain a safe flow of traffic .there is no money for better policing and you cannot fine everybody
attributes.additional_details: Other countries as Czech Republic Romania and Germany all have higher speed limits and this would lower intimidating driving

attributes.action: Call a UK referendum on what our new relationship with Europe should be.
attributes.background:
A referendum is now required to clarify the position of the people of the UK with regards the pending  negotiation of the UK's future relationship with the EU. An outline proposal 
1: Tariff-based trade as non EEA member
2: EEA membership subject to EU rules
3: Full EU membership

attributes.action: The World Heritage City of Bath Should Remain within the EU and leave the UK
attributes.background: The UK has voted to leave the EU after 43 years. A 57.9% majority of Bath residents voted to remain. There was a turnout of 105,298 in Bath & NE Somerset, that's 77.13%. 60,878 of residents voted to remain. We are a World Heritage City. We want to remain and share that heritage with Europe.

attributes.action: Referendum on the Terms of a Bill of Rights before Assent to Leave the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum set citizen versus citizen. The EU guaranteed Fundamental Rights. Hillsborough & Stafford show it was left to Citizens to enforce the most basic of Rights - to Life & for Justice. Government & MP's knew but failed - Year after Year. We cannot allowed such rights to be ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU requires a further treaty before Parliament. It should NOT BE passed without the fundamental rights of each UK citizen GUARANTEED first.

Mr Gove's plan is for a BILL OF RIGHTS to abolish the Human Rights Act when most citizens cannot enforce any current rights. 

RIGHTS TO BE TAKEN AWAY should be subject to REFERENDUM before the Act of Leaving. Limit their power to hurt YOU, your Family, & Fellow Citizens. SOVEREIGNTY means the MP is the servant and not the Master

Remind them.

attributes.action: Offer British citizenship to Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23 2016
attributes.background: The Polish people are longstanding & valued friends and allies of the UK, and we have deep ties which exceed and excel any EU links. We hereby petition the UK Government to extend an offer of automatic British Citizenship to all Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23rd 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
We deeply regret the sense of insult felt by the Polish nation resulting from the referendum decision to leave the EU. We wish to repair our relationship. We wish to recognise the outstanding contribution to peace of the Free Polish Army, and to reassure the UK's widespread, well integrated, Polish-heritage communities, which in many cases pre-date the formation of the EU. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/familyhistory/bloodlines/migration.shtml?entry=polish_free_forces&theme=migration

attributes.action: Nationally standardise the colours of commercial and domestic rubbish bins.
attributes.background: Each council area has a different colour scheme for rubbish and recycling bins. This often adds to confusion over what can be recycled, and recyclable waste is often thrown away, or recyclable materials are often put in the incorrect bins.
attributes.additional_details:
The colour scheme would become second nature to people's views towards waste disposal. The colour scheme could even extend to public litter bins on the streets.

Whilst this process could take some time, it could be implemented in a phased way, as and when bins are scheduled for routine replacement.

attributes.action: End Taxpayer Bail-outs of Banks by removing limitation of shareholder liability.
attributes.background: Between 2007 and 2010 the British Taxpayer bailed out the banks and bankers with cash and guarantees totalling £1,162 BILLION, equivalent to almost 3 times the total NHS budget for the same 4-year period! (Source: NAO; https://www.nao.org.uk/highlights/taxpayer-support-for-uk-banks-faqs/)
attributes.additional_details: The remedy is to ensure that shareholders are on the hook for all the banks' liabilities without a taxpayer safety net. They will then hold bank directors and management to account and monitor risk to prevent recurrences of such disasters. To achieve this, Parliament should remove shareholders' limited liability in banks (and any other business deemed too big to fail), so that shareholders, not taxpayers, are liable for all the banks' liabilities. There can be no reasonable objection to this.
